data.title: Authentic Northern India Food
data.text:
When we moved from England 26 years ago, the one thing we missed was Indian food. Restaurants have sprung up in Milpitas, Sunnyvale and Mountain View but good ones are still sparse in San Jose.

This was by far and away the best Northern Indian food I've had in San Jose - even better than the more expensive but better situated place with the stellar reputation.

We went for the lunch buffet and everything was good. The butter chicken was actually spicy - which might NOT be to everyone's taste but suited us.

The decor is down market  and it's definitely more of a cafe than a restaurant but is very well worth visiting for a casual lunch.

I'll be back to report on the a la carte items.
